text: if you haven't tried her chowder before
trust me you're really missing out it's
a delicious traditional Mexican aqua
fresca that's made by boiling and
soaking rice to extract sugars and
starches and then it's infused with
cinnamon the version here is quite
simple because you're just using
store-bought rice milk as the base the
classic flavor is so easy a cup of rice
milk this is also lactose free so that's
good for people who can't have dairy and
for sweetness a little agave nectar one
to two tablespoons I like to be on the
sweet side of things so I'm gonna do two
and cinnamon 1/8 of a teaspoon more or
less depending on how much you like it
and a pinch of salt
it just amps up the flavors of
everything else and you just quite
simply give it a good blend a voila and
then into a glass with ice to keep
things nice and cold and if you want a
little extra burst of cinnamon flavor a
little pinch on top and a straw next up
the strawberry version this variation
uses the exact same base as the classic
a cup of rice milk it should be cold
from the refrigerator of course and
since the strawberries are quite sweet
only a tablespoon of agave nectar here
cinnamon don't forget the pinch of salt
and this is a cup of strawberries here
now to haul a strawberry use a paring
knife bring your hand down to the tip
and press it into the top and then just
give it a turn that pulls it right out I
also have a really fun way of doing this
with a straw yes a straw it's so easy
start from the bottom and push it
straight through to the top and look at
that the top falls right off and you
have a perfectly hold strawberry this is
a cup of hauled and halved strawberries
that go in a quick blend now this will
satisfy your desire for something like a
milkshake but it's got a lot less fat
much healthier option and last but
certainly not least chocolate and
cinnamon are a match made in heaven and
you won't believe how delicious it is in
an orchard
so again a cup of rice milk the cinnamon
and a pinch of salt now for this version
it's important to combine the melted
chocolate and agave first before it goes
into the blender so that the chocolate
doesn't seize up I have one and a half
ounces here that's a quarter cup chopped
dark chocolate you could use milk
chocolate if that's your thing and I'm
gonna go full two tablespoons here since
there's not much sugar in dark chocolate
and just give that a good stir until
it's totally combined it'll start to
thicken instantly when you stir in that
agave and in it goes all of it oh yeah
this is something the kids will love
you'll like it too the burning question
